alert.note: Alert for Trinity (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 2:42PM PDT until August 19 at 3:45PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Eureka has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Trinity County in northwestern California... * Until 345 PM PDT. * At 242 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 to 2.5 inches of rainfall have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southern Trinity County FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2.5 INCHES IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
